'''Enthor''' was the husband of [[Hiril]], the daughter of [[Halmir]] [[Chieftain of Brethil]], as well as the father of [[Meleth]], the mother of [[Hunthor]] and [[Manthor]].<ref name="Enthor">{{WJ|Hurin}}, p. 270</ref>

It is likely that either Enthor or his son-in-law [[Agathor]] were descended from the [[House of Hador]].<ref>{{WJ|Hurin}}, "Notes", ''Note 55'', pp. 308-9</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
When ''[[The Wanderings of Húrin]]'' was being written there were different manuscripts with many name changes. 

In the earlier version, Enthor was the younger brother of [[Hunthor]] and [[Manthor]], and he was the captain of the guards near [[Brithiach]] whom [[Asgon]] met. 

However, in the last manuscript captain ''Enthor'' was replaced by ''[[Ebor]]'' who was "a chief henchman of Manthor's", and the words "younger brother of Hunthor and Manthor" were intended to be cut out, per [[Christopher Tolkien]].<ref name="Enthor"/> The newly named Ebor referred to Manthor as his lord rather than his brother, strengthening Christopher's suggestion.<ref>{{WJ|Hurin}}, p. 263</ref>
